chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher N Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse Co Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both Cts 1 & 2 are concurrent with each other, with the same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution as ordered.  Amount to be determined at Restitution Hearing.  Restitution will be Joint & Several with co-defendant(s)

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be applied toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

No Contact with Brittany S. (co-def) or with the victim, B.R.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
.

.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Ct 1 of this case
.
